Title: Firebird: Data disclosure
Synopsis:
Firebird allows remote connections to the administrative account without
    verifying credentials.

Background.Text: Firebird is a multi-platform, open source relational database.

Description.Text: Viesturs reported that the default configuration for Gentoo's init script ("/etc/conf.d/firebird") sets the "ISC_PASSWORD" environment variable when starting Firebird. It will be used when no password is supplied by a client connecting as the "SYSDBA" user.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker can authenticate as the "SYSDBA" user without providing the credentials, resulting in complete disclosure of all databases except for the user and password database (security2.fdb).

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Firebird users should upgrade to the latest version:

Note: /etc/conf.d is protected by Portage as a configuration directory.

    overwrite the "firebird" configuration file, and then restart Firebird.
